languagenames.:title: Language Names
languagenames.:comment: The names of various languages in the user's native language and alphabet, for example: Polish is Польский in Russian, 폴란드어 in Korean, polaco in Spanish, Russian is Rosyjski in Polish and so on.  My apologies if I have any of these wrong, I had to use Google-Fu and I'm not a native speaker of any of these languages, I did my best to check!  These names are used where the user will select a language, usually for things like the spellchecker.  This is not an exhaustive list of language names, at present, it just for languages Quoll Writer supports in some way, more will be added in later releases.

The %% is needed to display a literal % character.  %4$s is replaced with ${uilanguage.set.createdbyyou} if the strings were created by the user.

redownload.actionerror:
Warning! {QW} has been unable to re-download the User Interface strings for your selected language. There may be multiple reasons for this, such as a connection error to the internet or that the {QW} server is unavailable.

It is recommended that you either restart {QW} to try again or try downloading the strings from the Options panel.

In the interim {QW} has fallen back to using English.

confirmpopup.text:
{QW} has re-downloaded the User Interface language strings you are using because they were missing from your local system. In the interim the User Interface has fallen back to using English.

To return to using your selected language {QW} must be restarted.

update.actionerror:

It is recommended that you either restart {QW} to try again or try downloading the strings from the Options panel.

In the interim {QW} has fallen back to using English.

To make full use of the updated strings {QW} must be restarted.

license.title: {QW} End-user license
license.copyright: © Copyright [year] Gary Bentley, All rights reserved.
license.accept: I accept the terms of the license

1.title: No Warranties
1.text:
I'm sorry but I cannot provide any warranty for the use of {QW}. It is (and any related documentation) provided "as is" without warranty of any kind, either express or implied, including, without limitation, the implied warranties or merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose or noninfringement.

My apologies for the legalese but it is important, I have to cover myself and I cannot be held responsible for you using Quoll Writer. I have done my best to ensure that it is bug free and works as intended and will not corrupt your work but I cannot and will not guarantee it. You use {QW} at your own risk and I recommend that you create a test project to try it out first to ensure that you are happy that it fits your needs. That said, if you are having problems with one of your projects within {QW} then contact me as soon as possible and I will do my best to help resolve the issue.

2.title: Please back up your work
2.text:
By using {QW} you are agreeing that you will keep adequate backups of your work (produced via {QW}) and that the backups will be kept in a secure location that is suitable for the storage of digital information. Again, I cannot be held responsible if you lose your work, backups are a necessary evil that helps to ensure that your time and effort are not wasted. Please do not use {QW} if you ARE NOT doing regular backups. Please do not keep just a single copy of your work on disk, if you have a power cut and the {QW} project database becomes corrupted then it may not be possible to retrieve it.

PLEASE DO NOT LET THIS HAPPEN!

I also recommend that you use a secure online backup service to ensure redundancy. Personally I use IDrive, they’re cheap, reliable and it just works but there are many other backup providers.

3.title: If you like {QW} then tell other writers
3.text: If you like {QW} and it fits your needs then I would ask that you tell other writers you know about it.  If you do not like {QW} then I would ask that you are fair in your criticisms when you complain to others about it.

4.title: Let me know about bugs and your desire for new features
4.text: I am constantly looking to improve upon {QW}, I wrote it because I like to write and I am interested in the opinions of other writers about what they would like to see in a writing application.  I am also interested in ensuring that it is bug free and I would ask that you report any issues you have, and when you do so, please provide as much information as you can including screenshots where appropriate.  The more information I have, the easier bugs are to fix.

5.title: Do not lose your encryption password(s)
5.text: If you elect to encrypt your project(s) then please DO NOT lose your password. It is not stored ANYWHERE and so if you lose it/forget it then you WILL NOT be able to access your project (regardless of whether you have backups) either via {QW} or by using a database access mechanism such as the H2 console. The encryption used (see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Encryption_Standard ) is very strong and unless you are the NSA it won't be broken, so do not lose your password or you will lose your work.

basic.title: The basic details
basic.text: Enter the name and plural name (what do you call lots of your object) for your object. For example, you might call it ${userobjects.type.new.defaults.names.singular} and ${userobjects.type.new.defaults.names.plural}.

layout.text: Finally, and this step is optional, select how you want the fields to be displayed.  Remember you can change any of this information later so don't worry about it too much for now.

edit.actionerror: Unable to update the object type.

view.text: The layout tells {QW} how you want to display the fields for your %1$s. Certain fields like the object description and object image are given special locations in the layouts. For Columns of fields it just means that the fields are laid out in the order given in the Fields tab.
view.:comment.text: %1$s is the object type plural name.
view.name: %1$s name
view.:comment.name: %1$s is the object type name, such as 'Character' or 'Location'.

layouts.0: Fields are laid out in a single column.
layouts.1: The %1$s image, if present, is displayed in the top left corner and the %1$s description is shown to the right.  Two columns of fields are displayed underneath.
layouts.2: The %1$s image is shown in the top left corner with the %1$s description underneath.  The other fields are shown in a column on the right.
layouts.3: Two columns of fields are displayed.
layouts.4: The %1$s image is shown in the top right corner with the %1$s description underneath.  The other fields are shown in a column on the left.
layouts.5: The %1$s description is shown in a column on the right, all other fields are shown in a column on the left.
layouts.6: The %1$s description is shown in a column on the left, all other fields are shown in a column on the right.
layouts.7: The %1$s description is shown in a column on the left, the %1$s image is shown in the top right corner with all other fields in a column underneath.
layouts.8: The %1$s image is shown in the top left corner with the %1$s description in a column on the right.  The other %1$s fields are shown underneath the %1$s image.

deleteitem.:title: Deleting Items
deleteitem.:comment: This is a general purpose 'Delete this thing' action.  It is used by a number of functions, such as deleting a chapter or warmup or project.
deleteitem.title: Delete %1$s
deleteitem.:comment.title: %1$s is the type of thing that is to be deleted.
deleteitem.text: To delete %1$s %2$s please enter the word ${deleteitem.confirmword} into the box below.%3$s
deleteitem.:comment.text: %1$s is the type of thing that is to be deleted.  %2$s is the name of the thing, such as chapter name.  %3$s is an optional warning that some delete functions display to warn the user.  The confirmword value is the one used for confirmation of the deletion.  It should be an affirmative value, such as 'Yes' or 'Ok', i.e. short and fast to enter but indicates that the user agrees with the action.  When checked the case of the value entered will be ignored, so YES, Yes, or yes would work.
deleteitem.errorlabel: Please enter the word ${deleteitem.confirmword} to confirm the deletion.

tips.:title: Tips
tips.:comment: These items define the tips that are displayed to the user.
tips.1: {QW} has a Patreon page. If you want to help speed up development why not consider donating? Click here to view the Patreon page
tips.2: Did you know you can keep track of how much of a ${objectnames.singular.chapter} you have edited? Just right click at any point in the chapter and select ${objectnames.singular.chapter} Edit then [edit-point] Set Edit Point.
tips.3: Don't like what things are called? Click here to change them.
tips.4: There is an option to compress the right click menu you see when editing a ${objectnames.singular.chapter}. Click here to view options.
tips.5: Don't like the position of the tabs? Change it in the options. Click here to view options.
tips.6: Want to see where you are writing? Enable writing line highlighting in the text properties. Click here to view the text properties now.
tips.7: Want to change something? Check out the options, there might be a setting for it.
tips.8: Changing the setting of an option will take effect straight away, no need to save.
tips.9:
Want to work in full screen mode? Click to enter full screen mode now.
You can also press F5 or use the [fullscreen] button on the toolbar to enter full screen mode.
tips.10: Can't remember what the awesome was added in this release? Click to see what's new.
tips.11: Got writer's block? Why not try a ${objectnames.singular.warmup} exercise? To do a ${objectnames.singular.warmup} at any time select [warmups]${project.settingsmenu.items.dowarmup} from the ${objectnames.singular.project} menu.
tips.12:
Want to record your ideas? Click to open the ${names.ideaboard}.
You can open the ${names.ideaboard} at any time by selecting [idea]${project.settingsmenu.items.ideaboard}.
tips.13: Have you seen the user guide? Click to view the guide. You can access the online help at any time from the ${objectnames.singular.project} menu, then select [help]${project.settingsmenu.items.help} then [help]${project.settingsmenu.items.viewuserguide}.
tips.14_1:
Want to know how many words you've written? Click to see the word counts now.
You can also use Ctrl+W or the [wordcount] button from the toolbar to see how many words you've written.
tips.14_2: Want to know how many words you've written? Press Ctrl+W when editing a chapter or use the [wordcount] button from the toolbar to see how many words you've written.
tips.15:
Want to know see how many words you've written over time? Click to see the word count history now.
Press Ctrl+W or use the [wordcount] button from the toolbar then [wordcount]View Detail to view the history.
tips.16:
Want to manage the words in your personal dictionary? Click to manage your personal dictionary now.
The dictionary can be accessed from the project menu then select [edit-properties]Project Options and the ${objectnames.singular.chapter} tab.
tips.17:
Sick of those little red lines? Click to turn the spellchecker off.
Press Ctrl+L when editing a chapter or use the [spellchecker] button on the toolbar to turn the spellchecker on or off.
tips.18:
Want to keep track of your achievements? Click to check your achievements now.
You can track your progress at any time by selecting [achievement]${project.settingsmenu.items.achievements} from the ${objectnames.singular.project} menu.
tips.19: Like to use the keyboard rather than the mouse? Click to view the shortcuts.
tips.20:
You can import Microsoft Word files into your ${objectnames.singular.project}. Click to import a file.
You can also select [project-import]${project.settingsmenu.items.importfileorproject} from the ${objectnames.singular.project} menu to import.
tips.21:
You can export your ${objectnames.singular.project} to a number of different file formats? Click to export your ${objectnames.singular.project}.
You can also select [project-export]${project.settingsmenu.items.exportproject} from the ${objectnames.singular.project} menu to export.
tips.22:
Want to improve your writing and find problems with the text? Click to view the problem finder.
The problem finder can be accessed from the [tools] tools menu on the toolbar then selecting [eye]${names.problemfinder}.
tips.23:
You can use the problem finder in full screen mode. Click to view the problem finder in full screen mode now.
Full screen mode can be accessed from the toolbar by selecting [fullscreen] or pressing F5. The ${names.problemfinder} can be accessed from the [tools] tools menu on the toolbar then selecting [eye]Find Problems or using the shortcut Ctrl+Shift+P.
tips.24:
Want to check how readable your prose is? Click to view the check the readability now.
You can also check the readability by opening the word counts via Ctrl+W or use the [wordcount] button on the toolbar.
tips.25:
Don't like the font or font size? Click to change the text properties.
The text properties can be accessed from the [tools] menu on the toolbar then select [edit-properties]Edit Text Properties.
tips.26_1: Want to find a synonym?  Highlight a word while editing a ${objectnames.singular.chapter} and right click.
tips.26_2: Want to find a synonym?  Highlight a word and right click.
tips.27:
Missing the sound of a typewriter? Click to try out the typewriter sound.
You can turn the sound on or off (and change it) in the How things look and sound section of the options.
tips.28:
${objectnames.plural.warmup} can be converted into ${objectnames.plural.project}. Click to do a ${objectnames.singular.warmup} now.
You can do a ${objectnames.singular.warmup} at any time, just select [warmups]${project.settingsmenu.items.dowarmup} from the ${objectnames.singular.project} menu.
tips.29: In full screen mode you can change the size of the writing area and how transparent the background is?  Just move your cursor to the top of the screen to see the options.
tips.30: Did you know that in full screen mode you can change the color of the text and the background of the writing area? <a href='action:fullscreen'>Click to enter full screen mode now.
tips.31: Did you know that in full screen mode you can set an image for the background? Click to enter full screen mode now.
tips.32:
Looking to find where a word or term is mentioned? Click to open the find.
You can open the find with Ctrl+F or select [find]Find from the project menu at any time.

start.title: Getting started
start.text:
Welcome to the {QW} ${names.editorsservice}. The registration process only takes a minute and the service is free to use (no really).

If you've already registered don't worry just use the link at the bottom to find your ${objectnames.plural.editor} database.

Find out more about the ${names.editorsservice}
start.:comment.text: %1$s is a link to information page about the ${names.editorsservice}.

labels.viewtandc: View the Terms and Conditions for using the ${names.editorsservice}.
labels.agreetandc: I have read and agree to the Terms and Conditions of use
labels.alreadyregistered: Already registered?  Click here to find your ${objectnames.plural.editor} database folder.

reminderpopup.title: A gentle nudge
reminderpopup.text:
The Terms and Conditions only take a couple of minutes to read. There is even a tl;dr of the impotant bits.

It really is in your interests to give it a once over. Spare a couple of minutes and save yourself some hassle later.

Click to view the Terms & Conditions

errors.agreetandc: You must agree to the Terms and Conditions to continue.

Note: Your ${objectnames.plural.contact} database will not be deleted allowing you to keep a record of what you have sent and received. If you create another account you will not be able to use your current database.

Warning: deleting your account means you will no longer be able to send messages to any of your ${objectnames.plural.contact} or receive messages from them. A message will be sent to each of them telling them you have removed them.

savepasswordwarningpopup.:comment: This warning message is displayed when the user wants to save the password.  However there is no way to properly secure the password since any encryption key used would be available on the local machine conferring no benefit.
savepasswordwarningpopup.title: Warning!
savepasswordwarningpopup.text:
It is not recommended that your password is saved.

This is because there is no way to securely store the password on your local computer, encrypting the password would have no effect/benefit, because of this your password will be saved in clear text in your editor properties file.

If you understand the risks and are happy for the password to be stored in an insecure manner then please enter the word ${form.affirmativevalue} in the box below.

Note: if you select No, don't save it then you will have to enter the password each time you use login to the ${names.editorsservice}.

labels.:comment.latest: This is shown after the version name if it's the latest version sent by the contact.

labels.:comment: The {dueby}, {comments}, {unsent} and {sent} labels are used to construct a string that the user sees about the version.  It is presented as a sentence taking the form: '{dueby}{comments}[{unsent}|{sent}]', an example might be: Due by: 12 Nov 2018.  10 comments, all sent.  This is the reason why there are extra spaces at the end and commas at the start.

labels.optin: Opt-in to beta versions (enables auto-send of errors to {QW} support)

popup.title: About Betas
popup.text:
{QW} betas are opt-in and are designed to elicit feedback from users. They will be functionally complete and as bug free as possible. However they won't be without issues, so please beware and report any problems you find.

You can opt out at any time although this will not revert back to a previous version (that is potentially dangerous).

Note: opting into betas will enable the Send errors to {QW} support option, you can switch this off if you like to prevent errors being sent.

whatsnew.text: Welcome to version %1$s. This window describes the various changes that have been made since the last version and lets you setup new features. You can also see the full list of changes online.

targets.title: ${names.targets}
targets.text:
You can now set certain targets to track how your writing is progressing. Set targets for how much you write in a session, every day, week or month. A number of new charts have been added to help you track these statistics over time.

You can also specify targets for ${objectnames.singular.chapter} length and readability.

Click here to open the ${names.targets} sidebar which can be accessed from the ${objectnames.singular.project} menu.

updatedcharts.title: Updated Charts & some new ones
updatedcharts.text:
The charts have been revamped and some new ones have been added to help keep track of your targets.

Click here to open the Statistics/Charts panel.

chapterpreview.title: Improved ${objectnames.singular.chapter} previews
chapterpreview.text:
The popup displayed when you hold your mouse over a ${objectnames.singular.chapter} in the ${objectnames.singular.chapter} list has been improved and can be configured to display a variety of information.

See for more details.

Click here to change what is displayed.

import.title: Importing from your other ${objectnames.plural.project}
import.text:
You can now import ${objectnames.plural.asset} and ${objectnames.plural.chapter} from other ${objectnames.plural.project} into your ${objectnames.singular.project}.

Click here to import now.

problemfinder.title: New way to interact with the ${names.problemfinder}
problemfinder.text: The ${names.problemfinder} is great at finding all the problems within a ${objectnames.singular.chapter} but sometimes you want to hone in on a particular type of problem. Now you can! Either right click on a the checkbox for a found problem and select ${problemfinder.ignore.popupmenu.items.find} or use the ${names.problemfinder} rule config popup.

newrule.title: New double word rule
newrule.text: A new ${names.problemfinder} rule to find double word or double punctuation has been added.

assets.title: A big update to ${objectnames.plural.asset}
assets.text:
You can now add your own fields to your ${objectnames.plural.asset}. Additionally you can now create your own type of ${objectnames.plural.asset}, want to catalogue all the different types of cheeses in your stories? Now you can and you can record as much information about them as you'd like.

But it's a big topic, so if you want the full details click here.

tags.title: Tagging
tags.text: It's now possible to tag objects (Chapters, Assets, Scenes etc) to group them together into their own section. This way you can create logical groupings of objects and keep track of them. You can tag an object with as many tags as you like. For more information click here.

dnd.title: Hiding sections and more drag-n-drop
dnd.text:
Want to move and hide, sections in the project sidebar? Sections can now be moved around via drag-n-drop and if you never use Locations or Characters then why not hide the sections. If you're in the early stages of development of your story why not move the Characters to the top and hide the Chapters? You can easily add the sections back in later.

To add a section just right click on a section header or on the background of the project sidebar and select from the Add section menu.

To hide a section right click on the section header and select Hide this section.

forms.title: Form/input element layout
forms.text: The way that forms/input elements, such as text fields, are laid out and displayed has been changed to a stacked layout. This means that the field name is above the input field, rather than being to the left. This has pros and cons, it reduces the amount of dead space in the layout but increases the vertical size. A future version will add in the two column layout as an option. If you have a strong view on this then let me know.

uilanguages.title: User Interface Languages
uilanguages.text:
It's finally here. Support for other languages for the User Interface. At the time this was written there wasn't any non-English languages added, but there may be now, check the ${options.lookandsound.title} section in the ${options.title} panel to see what languages are available.

And if you fancy taking a crack at creating a translation yourself, check out the Selecting a User Interface Language help page for details on how to get started.

bugs.title: Bug fixes/minor improvements
bugs.text: A number of bug fixes relating to the User Interface strings editor have been made, mostly related to formatting and character encoding.

bugs.title: Bug fix
bugs.text: Fixed a bug preventing the name of a custom object from being displayed.

bugs.title: Bug fixes
bugs.text: Fixed a couple of issues relating to the EPUB and DOCX exports.  The language for each file will be set according to the current spellcheck language for the ${objectnames.singular.project}.

bugs.title: Bug fixes
bugs.text: When using full screen mode, the normal ${objectnames.singular.project} window will be hidden.

bugs.title: Bug fixes
bugs.text: Removing custom object fields won't now prevent the parent object from being deleted.

bugs.title: Bug fixes
bugs.text:
Fixed a couple of issues relating to the Import.

Fixed issues relating to accessing and downloading User Interface files.

Fixed a couple of issues relating to the What's New popup, WhatsNewCeption!

newfeatures.title: New Features
newfeatures.text:
The controls on the header bars of windows are now configurable. Just right click on a control and select Configure.

A new option has been added to the How things look and sound section of the options. that allows you to set the times when Night Mode should be automatically enabled.

The text properties are now aware of Night Mode and will change accordingly.

bugs.title: Bug fixes
bugs.text:
• Fixed the first use wizard so that its size is correct, it is also resizable.
  • Fixed the Night Mode colors for the chapter editor.
  • Fixed some issues relating to adding new Asset types.
  • Improved drag-n-drop on Linux.
  • Changed location of the log file(s) to be in the QuollWriter sub-folder of the home folder.
  • Fixed an issue that caused the Chapters to be removed from the sidebar when removing Editors.
  • Fixed an issue preventing Edit Needed notes from being edited.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes
bugs.text:
• Fixed an issue that prevented the UI language strings from being tried out.
  • The User UI language strings can now be deleted.
  • When reporting a bug the email address is now mandatory, I've lost count of the times I've needed to contact someone about an issue but don't have their email.
  • Fixed an issue with the Word Count sidebar.
  • The special QW value should now be replaced with Quoll Writer in text areas.
  • Cancelling out of the first use wizard will no longer show the All Projects window, instead QW will close.
  • Updated the file opener to try xdg-open first before trying to determine what flavor of Linux we are running on.
  • The chapter counts are now saved in the project and set up at startup time. This can lead to a delay in the project window appearing the first time but will be faster at all other times.
  • The help text in the Project Editors section of the sidebar will now only display when you have one or more Editors for the project.
  • Fixed an issue with the Targets sidebar not displaying the relevant link when a chapter goes over a limit.
  • Fixed an issue with the writing target reached popup not displayed.
  • Fixed an issue with the spell checker not being able to be enabled when editing a Warm-up.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented Warm-ups from being started due to the timer control not being present on the header.
  • Fixed a number of issues with the UI Language Strings Editor.
  • Fixed an issue preventing some Asset fields from being added.
  • Fixed the .docx import so that chapter text is found and imported correctly.
  • Fixed an issue with the import so that imported chapters are correctly added to the Project.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented encrypted Projects from being opened when QW first starts.
  • Finally, the What's New should appear when you start QW after upgrading, if it doesn't please let me know!

newfeatures.title: New Features
newfeatures.text:
• Scenes, Outline Items and Notes can now be dragged-n-dropped in the margin.
  • Added a help message to the Project sidebar that will be displayed if the user has no sections in the sidebar, hopefully this helps prevent confusion when it is empty.
  • .docx files can be dropped onto the Project window to being the import.
  • When opening an encrypted Project when QW starts, the All Projects window will now be displayed first and the popup asking for the password will be displayed within it.

changes.title: Changed/Removed Features
changes.text: Removed support for .doc files to be imported.  It has never worked properly and I can't get it to work properly.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes
bugs.text: • Fixed an issue in the First Use wizard that stopped users progressing past the license agreement.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes
bugs.text: • Fixed an issue that caused an error when replacing special values in text areas.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes
bugs.text:
• Fixed an issue that caused the Project viewer to be put into a zombie state when the Project was renamed.
  • Changing where the Project is stored no longer requires the Project to be closed.
  • Fixed an issue related to legacy English dictionary names that caused the spellchecker to not work.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/New Features
bugs.text:
• Fixed an issue that prevented Ideas from being deleted.
  • Ensured that the Chapters section name is updated when the user changes the name of the section.
  • Shortcut+E now properly displays the Text Properties sidebar.
  • Added the ability to specify the paragraph spacing in the Text Properties.
  • Made a number of style changes, including cleaning up some of the menus and standardizing the spacing in menus. This has the effect of each menu item having a little more room to breathe making them easier to use.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/New Features
bugs.text:
• Removed the base UI font size. QW will now try and use the window manager default. This may lead to some funny size issues though, let me know.
  • Popups can not be dragged outside of the window.
  • A number of issues relating to Editor Projects have been fixed.
  • Added the ability to permanently turn on Night Mode. When you turn it on the first time you will be asked if you want to make it permanent.
  • Fixed a number of style issues, mostly relating to Night Mode.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/Minor Improvements
bugs.text: • A number of bug fixes and minor changes, mostly style related.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/Minor Improvements
bugs.text: • A number of bug fixes relating to the User Interface strings and the editor.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/Minor Improvements
bugs.text: • Numerous fixes and minor improvements as a result of the formal testing.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/Minor Improvements
bugs.text: • Numerous fixes and minor improvements as a result of the formal testing. Please note: editor mode and the UI strings editor have not yet been fully tested, use with caution!

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/Minor Improvements
bugs.text: • More fixes and improvements as a result of the formal testing. The options panel has been reworked to be less of a cluttered nightmare.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/Minor Improvements
bugs.text:
• More fixes and improvements as a result of the formal testing.
  • The User Interface language strings editor has been fully tested and can be used now. Note: there may still be some string changes coming since Editor Mode still needs to be tested.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/Minor Improvements
bugs.text:
• More fixes and improvements as a result of the formal testing.
  • The User Interface language strings editor has been fully tested and can be used now. Note: there may still be some string changes coming since Editor Mode still needs to be tested.
  • Most of Editor Mode has been tested although there is still more to do. It is usable however.

bugs.title: Bug Fixes/Minor Improvements
bugs.text: • More fixes and improvements as a result of the formal testing.

bugs.title: Bug Fix
bugs.text: • Fix for a screen blinking problem introduced in b24 while in full screen. Sorry, missed this one!

new.title: Version 3
new.text:
So, version 3 is finally here. Thank you all for your patience, it's been a long road. There are lots of new features and to mention just a few:
  • Built on JavaFX
  • Night mode
  • More configurable interface
  • Assets are now more flexible and easier to use
  • The Options panel has been revamped
  • Available for Windows, macOS and Linux
I expect there to be some small updates in the coming weeks as I find and fix bugs that I didn't catch in testing, if you find any issues please let me know.

popup.title: Report a Bug/Problem
popup.text:
Complete the form below to report a bug/problem. An email address is required.

The version of {QW} and operating system you are using will also be sent (it helps with debugging). No personal information will be sent.

Please consider checking the box to send a screenshot, it helps a lot.
popup.errorlabel: Please enter a description of the problem/bug.
popup.noemail: Please enter an email address so you can be contacted about the problem/bug.

description.tooltip: Enter the bug/problem description here.  The more information you can provide the better.

sendscreenshot.text: Send a screenshot of current window
sendscreenshot.tooltip: Takes a screenshot of the current window and sends it to support.  If you have information you would prefer not to share then please change the tab before sending.  Uncheck to not send a screenshot, but please remember a picture is worth 1,000 (and more) words.

confirmpopup.title: Problem/Bug reported
confirmpopup.text: Thank you, the problem has been logged with {QW} support.  If you provided an email address then you should get a response within 2-3 days.  If not feel then free to send the message again.

popup.title: Contact Support
popup.text: Use the form below to contact {QW} support.  If you wish to receive a response then please provide an email address.

confirmpopup.title: Message sent
confirmpopup.text: Your request has been logged with {QW} support.  If you provided an email address then you should get a response within 1-2 days.  If not feel then free to send the message again.
